overview_of_class:
The philosophy behind this course, to use Donald Hall's words, is that "reading well precedes writing well." Students will read exemplary models of expository prose as a way of provoking ideas and encouraging effective written communication.


PROJECTS: Students will write and have the opportunity to revise 3 or 4 essays; individual conferences and workshops will encourage the writing process.
name: Intermediate Composition
title: WCAS ENGLISH 205-0-20 Intermediate Composition

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
The philosophy behind this course, to use Donald Hall's words, is that "reading well precedes writing well." Students will read exemplary models of expository prose as a way of provoking ideas and encouraging effective written communication.


PROJECTS: Students will write and have the opportunity to revise 3 or 4 essays; individual conferences and workshops will encourage the writing process.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Some of the authors we shall study are Annie Dillard, Walker Percy, Frank Conroy, and Eudora Welty. In addition to Hall's The Contemporary Essay, we shall use Writing Well, a composition text that emphasizes writing as discovery.

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: Questions about this course should be directed to: The Cook Family Writing Program: writing-program@northwestern.edu

subject: ENGLISH
